title: Node (networking)
summary: In telecommunications networks, a node (Latin: nodus,  ‘knot’) is either  a redistribution point or a communication endpoint. The definition of a node depends on the network and protocol layer referred to. A physical network node is an electronic device that is attached to a network, and is capable of creating, receiving, or transmitting information over a communication channel.[1] A passive distribution point such as a distribution frame or patch panel is consequently not a node.
